posts.title: Timeline of these first 39 days
posts.content:
• Let's try this out
  • I'm amazed, AI is the best teacher in the world
  • I like it, it's a challenge
  • This stuff is for me, difficult, satisfying, creative
  • Am I really going to be able to make a pretty cool webapp out of thin air?
  • I'm starting two more web app in parallel
  • Yes, I did it. Now let's try it on Android, which seems easier and is free.
  • What the hell is this Android Studio thing?
  • Come on, it's a challenge, calm down
  • Android is a fucking nightmare to develop for
  • I'm giving up on it, I'm focusing on the web app, period
  • What if I try it for iOS? I'd have to redo everything from scratch
  • Well, it's cool, I like it, it's convenient and pretty.
  • I love it.
  • What? I've already finished the first iOS app?
  • "Your app is pending approval"
  • Approved


My app launches on Monday, December 1st


Yeah! App - Stats:

* Total lines of Swift code: ~10,004 lines

* Number of files: 35 files


Breakdown:

* Views (UI): ~4,500 lines

* Managers (Business Logic): ~2,500 lines

* Models (Data): ~800 lines

* Widgets & Extensions: ~1,500 lines

* App Intents & Shortcuts: ~700 lines
